NYC vs California — Health & Humanities
About

NYC vs California — Health & Humanities

Welcome! This project compares New York City and California through a health & humanities lens, using a minimalist static site (Jekyll + GitHub Pages).

Below is a quick, human-readable comparison that’s generated from a small dataset in _data/compare.yml.

Public Narratives

NYC: Dense media ecosystem; neighborhood-level storytelling; immigrant press traditions.

California: Statewide narratives vary—tech corridors, agricultural regions, and border communities.

Note: Summarize themes; add citations later.

Cultural Institutions

NYC: Libraries, museums, archives clustered; strong public programs in borough systems.

California: Distributed across major metros (SF, LA, SD); rich UC system libraries/archives.

Note: Point to specific institutions when you add references.

Health Access & Policy

NYC: City-backed programs; dense hospital network; community health orgs.

California: Large Medi-Cal program; county variation; community clinics ecosystem.

Note: Replace with sourced facts as you refine.

Humanities Methods

NYC: Oral histories, urban ethnography, neighborhood archives.

California: Narratives across migration/agrarian histories; multilingual oral histories.

Note: List methods you know; link to examples later.

Tip: This site is deliberately minimal. Add citations/links as you refine.

NYC vs California — Health & Humanities
